newsitem.title: INDIA: India software stocks rally after tax concession.
newsitem.headline: India software stocks rally after tax concession.

text.p: Shares of Indian software firms staged a sharp rally on Thursday at the National Stock Exchange after the government offered a tax concesssion to profits earned from software exports, traders said.
Finance Minister P. Chidambaram said on Wednesday that he was proposing to exclude profits earned from software exports from a mininum tax on companies.
Chidambaram told parliament that the government had introduced the change in the 1997/98 (April-March) Finance bill which parliament is expected to approve on Friday.
At the National Stock Exchange, NIIT shares rose 5.70 rupees to 376.0, Infosys 40.0 to 1,467.0, Satyam Computers 3.30 to 73.80 rupees and Tata Unisys 15.0 to 600.
Software stocks have been market outperformers in recent months, with many brokerage firms giving "buy" recommendations on the companies forecasting strong performance.
The Bombay Stock Exchange is closed for a local holiday, but other Indian exchanges are open.
